intro: Copiapoa hypogaea subsp. hypogaea, commonly known as the Santa Rosalia, is a species of cactus native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stem that can reach up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its roots are adapted to absorb water from the extremely arid environment. It is a slow-growing plant that requires minimal water and is highly valued for its ornamental beauty.
